insights: The pod url-shorten-mongodb-75c967659f-2nk99 in namespace test-social-network was in CrashLoopBackOff with a high restart count (Restart Count: 26) and the container had a recent Exit Code: 14.

Container logs contain the explicit error: "The provided SSL certificate is expired or not yet valid." followed by a fatal assertion and fassert abort in ssl_manager_openssl.cpp, indicating MongoDB aborted during startup due to an SSL error.
The pod mounts a TLS Secret named mongodb-tls (volume tls-cert) which is the source of the certificate used by MongoDB; this Secret provides the invalid certificate observed in the logs.

Root cause: an invalid TLS certificate (expired or not yet valid) in the mongodb-tls Secret caused MongoDB to abort at startup, producing the CrashLoopBackOff. The mounted mongod.conf (ConfigMap) was present but logs point to the TLS cert as the failure source, not the config file.

Confirmed hypothesis: the startup failure was caused by the TLS certificate from the mounted Secret. Disproven/unsupported hypothesis: a mongod.conf misconfiguration was not indicated by the logs as the primary cause.
Immediate remediation: replace or rotate the mongodb-tls Secret with a valid certificate (ensure validity period and node time alignment) and restart the pod so MongoDB can start successfully.
